content: What city hosted the Summer Olympics in 2016, becoming the first South American city to do so?

The city that hosted the Summer Olympics in 2016 and became the first South American city to do so was Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The games took place from August 5 to August 21, 2016, and featured approximately 11,300 athletes from 207 nations competing in 306 events across 42 different sports and disciplines. This was the first time that the Olympics were held in South America, and only the third time they were held in the Southern Hemisphere, after Melbourne, Australia in 1956 and Sydney, Australia in 2000.
